name: Villa Epecuén #1
description: Back in the 1920s, a tourist village was established along the shore of Lago Epecuen, in Buenos Aires, Argentina. The town thrived for several decades until a tragic day in 1985, the salty waters broke through an earthen dam and Villa Epecuén was doomed. 25 years later the city finally emerged, revealing that the high levels of salt left a white residue on every building, painting the whole village white and making it a true ghost town.
